alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 6:49AM CDT until March 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slick Roads As Snow Continues... .Precipitation will continue for much of the day with visibilities reduced to under a mile at times and snow rates exceeding 1/2 inch per hour. Light freezing drizzle may also be possible as heavier snowfall exits east this morning. Additional accumulations are expected this evening, across north-central Wisconsin, with moderate confidence in exact location of a heavier snow band. Given the higher amounts clipping Taylor County, have upgraded to warning for the remaining headline period. Increased snowfall amounts and rates may just graze northeastern edges of Clark County as well. Slow down and use extra caution if driving today and tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Overall additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches with higher amounts possible in northeastern part of the County. Ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. * WHERE...Clark County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
